results.title: Tumour necrosis factor-alpha, interleukin-1beta and interleukin-8 induce persistent mechanical nociceptor hypersensitivity.
results.text_hl: The co-treatment of the animals with IL-8 plus @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, but not with @CHEMICAL_Indomethacin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007213 @@@indomethacin@@@, prevented the induction of persistent mechanical @<m>DISEASE_Drug_Hypersensitivity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004342 @@@nociceptor hypersensitivity@@@.

citations.NLM: Sachs D, Cunha FQ, Poole S, Ferreira SH. Tumour necrosis factor-alpha, interleukin-1beta and interleukin-8 induce persistent mechanical nociceptor hypersensitivity. Pain. 2002 Mar;96(1-2):89-97. PMID: 11932065
citations.BibTeX: @article{11932065, title={Tumour necrosis factor-alpha, interleukin-1beta and interleukin-8 induce persistent mechanical nociceptor hypersensitivity.}, author={Sachs D and Cunha FQ and Poole S and Ferreira SH}, journal={Pain}, volume={96}, number={1-2}, pages={89-97}}

results.title: Withdrawal phenomena after atenolol and bopindolol: haemodynamic responses in healthy volunteers.
results.text_hl: The results show that @DISEASE_Substance_Withdrawal_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D013375 @@@withdrawal phenomena@@@ occur following both drug treatments. @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ produced a @<m>DISEASE_Drug_Hypersensitivity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004342 @@@hypersensitivity@@@ to @CHEMICAL_Isoproterenol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007545 @@@isoprenaline@@@ and a small overshoot of HR in response to physiological manoeuvres.

citations.NLM: Walden RJ, Tomlinson B, Graham B, Liu JB, Prichard BN. Withdrawal phenomena after atenolol and bopindolol: haemodynamic responses in healthy volunteers. Br J Clin Pharmacol. 1990 Oct;30(4):557-65. PMID: 1981318
citations.BibTeX: @article{1981318, title={Withdrawal phenomena after atenolol and bopindolol: haemodynamic responses in healthy volunteers.}, author={Walden RJ and Tomlinson B and Graham B and Liu JB and Prichard BN}, journal={Br J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={30}, number={4}, pages={557-65}}

results.title: The child with recurrent syncope: autonomic function testing and beta-adrenergic hypersensitivity.
results.text_hl: The child with recurrent @DISEASE_Syncope @DISEASE_MESH:D013575 @@@syncope@@@: autonomic function testing and @<m>DISEASE_Drug_Hypersensitivity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004342 @@@beta-adrenergic hypersensitivity@@@.

citations.NLM: Perry JC, Garson A Jr. The child with recurrent syncope: autonomic function testing and beta-adrenergic hypersensitivity. J Am Coll Cardiol. 1991 Apr;17(5):1168-71. PMID: 1672538
citations.BibTeX: @article{1672538, title={The child with recurrent syncope: autonomic function testing and beta-adrenergic hypersensitivity.}, author={Perry JC and Garson A Jr}, journal={J Am Coll Cardiol}, volume={17}, number={5}, pages={1168-71}}

results.title: The critical role of leukotriene B4 in antigen-induced mechanical hyperalgesia in immunised rats.
results.text_hl: Pretreatment with @CHEMICAL_Indomethacin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007213 @@@indomethacin@@@ (5 mg kg(-1)) or @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (1 mg kg(-1)) reduced the OVA-induced @<m>DISEASE_Drug_Hypersensitivity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004342 @@@hypersensitivity@@@ at 1 and 3 h, but not at 5 h after challenge, while the combination of @GENE_UGT1A1 @GENE_24861 @@@B(1) and B(2) bradykinin receptor antagonists@@@ was ineffective over the same times. 6.

citations.NLM: Cunha JM, Sachs D, Canetti CA, Poole S, Ferreira SH, Cunha FQ. The critical role of leukotriene B4 in antigen-induced mechanical hyperalgesia in immunised rats. Br J Pharmacol. 2003 Jul;139(6):1135-45. PMID: 12871832
citations.BibTeX: @article{12871832, title={The critical role of leukotriene B4 in antigen-induced mechanical hyperalgesia in immunised rats.}, author={Cunha JM and Sachs D and Canetti CA and Poole S and Ferreira SH and Cunha FQ}, journal={Br J Pharmacol}, volume={139}, number={6}, pages={1135-45}}

results.title: Mechanisms underlying the nociceptive responses induced by platelet-activating factor (PAF) in the rat paw.
results.text_hl: Notably, the same antineutrophil migration strategies significantly prevented the increase of @GENE_MPO @GENE_303413 @@@myeloperoxidase@@@ activity induced by @GENE_PCLAF @GENE_300795 @@@PAF@@@. The @<m>DISEASE_Drug_Hypersensitivity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004342 @@@mechanical hypersensitivity@@@ caused by @GENE_PCLAF @GENE_300795 @@@PAF@@@ was also prevented by the cyclooxygenase inhibitors @CHEMICAL_Indomethacin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007213 @@@indomethacin@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Celecoxib @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068579 @@@celecoxib@@@, and by the selective @GENE_ADRB1 @GENE_24925 @@@beta(1) adrenergic receptor@@@ antagonist @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Marotta DM, Costa R, Motta EM, Fernandes ES, Medeiros R, Quintão NL, Campos MM, Calixto JB. Mechanisms underlying the nociceptive responses induced by platelet-activating factor (PAF) in the rat paw. Biochem Pharmacol. 2009 Apr 1;77(7):1223-35. PMID: 19283893
citations.BibTeX: @article{19283893, title={Mechanisms underlying the nociceptive responses induced by platelet-activating factor (PAF) in the rat paw.}, author={Marotta DM and Costa R and Motta EM and Fernandes ES and Medeiros R and Quintão NL and Campos MM and Calixto JB}, journal={Biochem Pharmacol}, volume={77}, number={7}, pages={1223-35}}
